page.title: 12Farming Then and Now
page.content: Farming in Burton was a lot different in 1939.The crops were different they were mainly root crops.Before the war the work was done by horse drawn cart implements such as a Binder(to cut the corn)but a Combined Harvester does it now.Modern machinery is much larger but it only needs one person to operate it.A Sugar Beet Harvester lifts,trims and drops the beet into the trailer.The old fashioned way required a large work force and quite a number of operations picking,carting off,putting in a clamp and bagging.There were lots of special jobs such as thatching the stack-no need now.Not so many workers are needed to operate the machines .In the old times each worker had a piglet to feed and fatten up.Today computers help some farmers to plan out crops,before the war they used paper.
